snippet: The retailer will compensate 4,500 workers for unpaid overtime and pay nearly $464,000 in penalties.
abstract: Labor Department says that Wal-Mart Stores will pay $4.8 million in back wages and damages to more than 4,500 employees nationwide for unpaid overtime after improperly considering the workers to be exempt.
lead_paragraph: The retailer will compensate 4,500 workers for unpaid overtime and pay nearly $464,000 in penalties.

headline.seo: Wal-Mart to Pay $4.8 Million in Back Overtime
